simplified: Dreams can show you things you think about, even if you don't know it. Many people have similar dreams, like flying, falling, or losing teeth. Sometimes you dream you are naked in public. These common dreams often mean the same thing for many people. But to truly understand your dream, you need to connect it to your daily life. Think about your feelings and what happens to you.

Dreams can give you insights into thoughts you didn't know you had. Common dreams, like flying, falling, losing teeth, or being naked in public, often have similar meanings for many people. But to understand what these dreams mean specifically for you, it's important to connect them to the events and feelings in your daily life.

Moscow has many wild dogs. About 35,000 dogs live on the streets. Some dogs were born wild. Other dogs were pets, but their owners left them. Some dogs live alone. Other dogs live in groups. In 2010, scientists looked at these dogs. They saw that the dogs learned to live well in the city. The dogs learned to cross roads with people. Some dogs even seem to know what traffic lights mean.

The wild dogs of Moscow are an interesting example of animals living in a city. Around 35,000 wild dogs live on the streets there. Some of these dogs were born wild, while others were once pets that their owners left behind. Some dogs live by themselves, and others live in groups called packs. In 2010, scientists studied these dogs. They found that the dogs have learned to live very successfully in the city. For example, they have learned that it is safer to cross the street when people are crossing. Also, some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

RJ Palacio wrote her first book. It is called Wonder. She lives in New York. She saw a girl with a different face. This gave her the idea for the book. Wonder is a very popular book in America. It won many awards. Schools use it to talk about bullying and friendship. They also talk about being different. A movie of Wonder is coming. Many people want to read RJ Palacio's next book.

Wonder is the first novel by RJ Palacio, who is from New York. She explained on her website that she got the idea for the book after seeing a girl with facial differences. Wonder has become a bestseller in the United States and has received several awards. Many schools use it to discuss important topics like bullying, friendship, and what it feels like to be different. A film version is now being made, and many people, including me, are looking forward to RJ Palacio's next book.

Chloe has two pet rats. Their names are Zena and Roxy. Chloe knows that many people do not think rats are good pets. She often tells people that rats are clean. She says they are very good pets if you care for them well. Chloe understands why people do not like rats. She did not like them before. Her friend Martin had pet rats. He showed them to Chloe. Chloe saw that they were loving and smart. Last year, Martin's rat had babies. Chloe decided to get two of the baby rats.

Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. She knows rats are not common pets. Chloe often explains to people that rats are not dirty. She tells them that rats can be wonderful pets if they are looked after properly. She understands why some people have a bad opinion of rats. Chloe did not like rats herself until her friend Martin showed her his pets. She then saw how loving and intelligent they were. Last year, when Martin's rat had babies, Chloe decided she wanted two of them.

Cape Town is not safe for baboons. Cars hurt or kill some baboons. Electric wires also hurt them. Baboons are in danger of dying out. To help them, the city hired people called Baboon Monitors. These people chase baboons away from the city. Or they catch them and let them go in the countryside. This plan helps a little. But baboons still come back to the city for food.

Baboons in Cape Town face many dangers. Some are hurt or killed by cars, and others get electric shocks from cables. Baboons are an endangered animal, meaning there are not many left. To protect them and reduce problems between people and baboons, the city council hired a team of Baboon Monitors. These monitors try to keep baboons out of city areas. They either chase them away or catch them and release them in the countryside. This plan has worked somewhat, but it is hard to stop baboons from returning to the city when they find easy food there.

I work for a big computer company. Its main office is in America. I work from home on my computer. I don't travel to an office or talk much with co-workers. I work on different jobs. This is good because I can take time off easily. For example, for my children's school shows or a dentist visit. But sometimes I work late at night. I might miss dinner to finish my work.

I work for a global IT company, but its main office is in the United States. So, I work from home online. This means I don't spend time traveling to work or chatting with colleagues. I work on projects, which gives me a lot of flexibility. This is important because I can take time off when my children have school events or when I need to go to the dentist. However, a problem is that I often work late into the evening because there are no fixed office hours. Sometimes I even skip dinner to finish a task.

In the 1990s, graffiti was still popular. At the same time, a lot of street art appeared all over the world. Some artists wanted to share political ideas. They made art about war, unfairness, and treating people badly. Other artists just wanted to make beautiful art. In South America, many street artists painted in poor areas. They made grey city walls colourful and full of life.

During the 1990s, graffiti continued, but there was also a significant rise in street art globally. Some artists aimed to make political statements, creating art that encouraged people to think about war, inequality, and discrimination. Other street artists were more interested in producing attractive and beautiful pieces. For instance, in South America, many street artists worked in disadvantaged areas, adding colour, life, and beauty to plain city walls.

Every day, people see many things to buy. They see them on social media, in magazines, and in shops. People in Britain buy more clothes and shoes now. It is easy to buy things online. So, people buy without thinking. Big shops sell very cheap clothes. People wear them only a few times. Then they throw them away.

Social media, magazines, and shop windows constantly show people many things to buy. Because of this, people in Britain are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping makes it easy for customers to buy without thinking. Also, major brands sell clothes so cheaply that people treat them like disposable items, wearing them only a few times before throwing them away.

Sam looked at the sun. He saw dust from a car far away. The car went to the Big House. Horses moved their legs and tails. They did not care that their owner was coming. He had not been there for ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter did not often come here. Sam liked that. If Sam stayed away from his boss, he would keep his job. Mr Carter wiped sweat from his neck. His shirt was wet. His skin was red from the sun. He looked like a man who worked inside. Other people did the hard work for him.

Sam looked at the sun, seeing a dust cloud from a car driving towards the Big House. The horses kicked and flicked their tails at flies, not seeming to care that their owner was visiting for the first time in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter usually only came to this place if he had to, which Sam preferred. He knew that if he stayed out of his boss's way, he would keep his job longer. Mr Carter wiped sweat from his neck. His shirt had wet spots that looked like shapes on a map. His skin was already getting red from the June sun. He looked like a man who made money indoors while others did the physical work.

People in Berlin, Germany, did not like pigs being shot. They said it was cruel. Hunters and animal lovers argued a lot. So, the city council decided to try something else. They stopped shooting the pigs. Now, they put up fences. It is also against the law to feed the pigs. We do not know if this plan will work. There are more pigs now because winters are warmer.

Many people in Berlin, Germany, complained about pigs being shot. They felt it was too cruel. This led to strong disagreements between hunters and animal lovers. Because of these protests, the city council decided to take a more peaceful approach. Instead of shooting the pigs, they put up fences. They also made it illegal to feed them. It is uncertain if this new strategy will be effective. This is partly because warmer winters mean there are now more pigs than in the past.

Suzanne Collins loves old Greek stories. She liked the story of Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, Athens had to send 7 boys and 7 girls to Crete every year. They went into a big maze. A monster called the Minotaur ate them. But a boy named Theseus fought and killed the monster. Suzanne thinks Katniss from Hunger Games is like Theseus in the future.

Suzanne Collins found a key idea for the Hunger Games books in her love for ancient Greek myths. As a child, she especially enjoyed the tale of Theseus and the Minotaur. In this myth, the city of Athens was ruled by Crete, but the Athenians rebelled. As a result, King Minos of Crete forced Athens to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete each year. These young people were then put into a labyrinth and eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. However, one of the youths, Theseus, fought and killed the monster. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a futuristic version of Theseus.

Zoos bring people and animals together. They can teach people about saving animals. They can make people want to protect animals and their homes. Some zoos help animals that were hurt in circuses. They also help pets that people left alone. Zoos also study animals. They learn about how animals act. They also learn how to make sick animals well.

Zoos connect people with animals. They can teach the public about protecting nature and encourage them to help animals and their homes. Some zoos offer a safe place for animals that were treated badly in circuses, or for pets that were left behind. Zoos also do important studies on things like how animals behave and how to cure their sicknesses.

A new idea is growing. It is called 'buy nothing'. This idea is against buying too many things. It started in Canada in the 1990s. Then it came to the USA. In the USA, people did not want to buy too much on big shopping days like Black Friday. On 'Buy Nothing Day', people protest. They cut their credit cards. All year, 'Buy Nothing' groups help people swap and fix things they already have.

A different trend is appearing that goes against consumerism, called the 'buy nothing' trend. This idea began in Canada in the early 1990s and then moved to the US. There, it became a way to reject the excessive spending and buying that happens on Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On 'Buy Nothing Day', people organize various protests and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, 'Buy Nothing' groups arrange for people to exchange and repair items they already own.

Is graffiti art or bad writing? Some people think it is art. But in many places, writing or painting on buildings or other things you don't own is called vandalism. Vandalism means damaging property. The police have stopped many street artists. Some artists had to pay money because of this. City governments say it costs a lot of money to clean graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

People often ask if graffiti is art or vandalism. It depends on how you see it. However, in many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is seen as vandalism. This means it is against the law. Many street artists have been caught by the police, and some have had to pay fines. City councils often complain about the high cost of removing graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

The art world is starting to like graffiti and street art more. They now see it as a real type of art. Big art shows of street art have been in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. An American artist, Elura Emerald, had a street art show in New York in 2008. She said street artists just show their feelings and do not hurt anyone. She thinks people should like and praise them.

The art world is increasingly recognizing the value of graffiti and street art as an art form. Major exhibitions of street art have been held in galleries in cities like Paris, London, and Los Angeles. In 2008, American artist Elura Emerald organized a street art exhibition at a New York gallery. She defended street artists, stating that they are simply expressing themselves and not harming anyone, and therefore should be appreciated and celebrated.

Most people dream 4 to 6 times every night after they are 10 years old. This means about 2,000 dreams each year. When a person is 80, they might have had 140,000 dreams. We forget almost all our dreams, maybe 95% to 99%. But we still remember thousands of dreams in our life. Sometimes, something in a dream is like something that happens in real life. This is often just a coincidence. It happens more if the dream is about normal things we do every day.

Most people have four to six dreams every night after they turn ten. This means they experience about 2,000 dreams each year. By the age of 80, an average person could have had 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget 95–99% of our dreams, we still remember thousands of them over our lifetime. It's not hard to believe that a dream event might coincidentally be followed by a similar real-life event, especially if the dream is about something common in daily life.

The story "The Hunger Games" happens in the future. This is after North America was destroyed. The country is called Panem. It has twelve poor areas called districts. A rich city called the Capitol rules them. The Capitol has all the power. Each district makes different things for the Capitol. District 12 gives all the coal. This is where the story starts. There was a thirteenth district before. It fought the Capitol and was destroyed.

The Hunger Games takes place in the future, after North America was destroyed. The country is called Panem. It is made up of twelve poor districts that are controlled by the wealthy Capitol. The Capitol has complete power over the nation. Each district is responsible for making different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story begins, provides all the coal for the country. There used to be a thirteenth district, but it rebelled against the Capitol and was destroyed.

Wild animals often come to cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons now come to areas where people live. They open rubbish bins and eat fruit from gardens. Some baboons even go into houses. They take food from kitchens. Baboons can be aggressive. They have attacked many pets. So, many people in the city do not want them there.

Wild animals often come into cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons have started coming into residential areas near the city. They open rubbish bins and eat fruit from gardens. Some baboons have even gone into people's houses and taken food from kitchens. Baboons can be aggressive and have attacked many pets. Because of this, many city residents do not want them around.

Many accidents happen when bridges are being built. Engineers sometimes make mistakes. For example, they might calculate something wrong. This causes accidents. The bridge falls down because it is too heavy. Workers on the bridge can die.

Many bridge accidents happen while bridges are being built. These accidents often occur because engineers make mistakes, such as a miscalculation. The bridge then collapses under its own weight, which can be deadly for the workers on it.

George Lucas was a movie director. He used a special story idea called the "hero's journey." In this idea, a hero lives a normal life. Then, something important happens. This makes the hero go on an adventure. This adventure changes everything for them. For example, in Star Wars, Luke lives with his aunt and uncle. He fixes robots. He finds a message from Princess Leia in a robot. This message is the start of his adventure.

George Lucas was an early film director who based his stories on a pattern called the "hero's journey." This journey typically starts with the hero living an ordinary life. However, something happens that calls them to an adventure, which then changes everything. For example, in Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life with his aunt and uncle, repairing robots. When he finds Princess Leia's message to Obi-Wan Kenobi inside the robot R2D2, this is 'the call to adventure' that begins his journey.

Sometimes, people think about stopping a big space rock from hitting Earth. This rock is called an asteroid. One idea is to use a nuclear bomb. A nuclear bomb is a very strong explosion. This idea is like a movie. But NASA has a real plan. It is called HAMMER. They want to send big rockets to the asteroid. These rockets weigh 8 tons. They hope to push the asteroid away. If it is too close, the rockets will have nuclear bombs to blow it up.

One idea to protect Earth from a dangerous asteroid is to use a nuclear weapon. This might sound like a movie plot, like the film Armageddon, but NASA has a real plan called HAMMER. This plan involves sending eight-ton rockets towards an asteroid that is coming close to Earth. The goal is to push the asteroid off its path. However, if the asteroid is too close for this to work, the rockets would instead carry nuclear bombs to destroy it.

A hero first says no to an adventure. A helper, called a mentor, then comes. The mentor helps the hero. The hero decides to go into a special new world. This is where the adventure happens. In this world, the hero does difficult things. They fight bad people and meet friends. This gets the hero ready for their biggest challenge. For example, Luke Skywalker is a hero. Obi-Wan is his mentor. Han Solo, R2D2, and C3PO are his friends. Darth Vader is his enemy. The special world is the Death Star.

Heroes often first refuse to go on an adventure. However, a mentor appears to guide them. With this help, they decide to enter a "special world" where the adventure takes place. In this new world, the hero faces tests, fights enemies, and meets friends. These experiences prepare them for their greatest challenge. For example, Luke Skywalker's mentor is Obi-Wan. His friends are Han Solo, R2D2, and C3PO. His enemy is Darth Vader, and the special world is the Death Star.

Some things are not used much. They may seem like they have no use. But other people can find them useful. The internet helped. People found a way to make money. They share things they do not use often. Websites and social media help people buy and sell used items. It is easy for people to share with each other now. This is called the sharing economy.

Items that are not used often might seem useless to some, but they can be valuable to others. With the internet, online communities have discovered how to earn money by sharing these underused items. Websites and social media groups make it easy for people to buy and sell second-hand goods directly. This system is known as the sharing economy.

Long ago, people had two main ideas about dreams. One idea was that dreams show us things we don't know about ourselves. Freud thought dreams could help us understand our secret feelings and problems. The other idea was different. It said dreams are just random pictures in our brain. Our brain makes these pictures when it sorts memories from the day. When we wake up, we try to make a story from these random pictures.

During the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular. One idea was that dreams show us things hidden from our conscious mind. Freud believed that understanding dreams could help us understand our hidden feelings and the problems they cause. However, the other theory was the opposite. It suggested that dreams are just random activity in the brain as it organizes memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random images and feelings by putting them into a story.

I work for myself. I am a freelancer. I like to decide what I do and when. At first, I worked at home. But it was hard to focus. Many things stopped me. Like cleaning, tea, and my family. So I went to a café to work. The internet was bad. I drank too much coffee. Then, I rented a desk. It was in a shared office with five other freelancers. I liked getting ready for work. I could focus well in the office.

I am a freelancer, which means I work for myself. I like being in charge of my tasks and my schedule. I first tried working from home, but I found it hard to concentrate. There were many distractions, like housework, making tea, and my family needing my attention. So, I started going to a café to work. However, the internet connection was not good, and I drank too much coffee. In the end, I decided to rent a desk in a co-working space with five other freelancers. I enjoyed getting ready for work and being able to focus in an office environment.

NASA wants to find space rocks called NEOs. To do this, NASA needs money. With money, they can build a special telescope called NEOCam. This telescope is 0.5 meters big. It sees heat (infrared light) to find the rocks. If they get the money, they can find the rocks in 10 years. After finding them, a team needs to learn how to stop the dangerous rocks (PHAs) from hitting Earth.

NASA needs money to build a special space telescope called NEOCam. This telescope is 0.5 meters wide and uses infrared light to find asteroids, which are called NEOs. If NASA gets the money, they believe they can find these asteroids within ten years. Once these asteroids are found, a team will then need to plan how to protect Earth from the most dangerous ones, known as PHAs.

The 'buy nothing' idea is now popular with social media stars. These stars usually show clothes and makeup to buy. But now, some tell people not to buy anything for a year. Two friends in Canada tried this. For one year, they only bought food. First, they did not buy electronics, clothes, or things for their home. Then, they stopped buying services. This means no haircuts, no eating at restaurants, or no gas for their cars. They saved $55,000 in one year.

The 'buy nothing' trend is now popular with social media influencers. These influencers often show clothes and makeup they recommend. However, some YouTube stars now encourage their viewers to buy nothing at all for periods as long as a year. For instance, two friends in Canada spent a year trying to buy only food. For the first three months, they learned to live without buying electrical goods, clothes, or things for their house. In the next stage, they stopped using services, such as getting haircuts, eating at restaurants, or buying petrol for their cars. In one year, they saved $55,000.

Pi likes religion. His family is Hindu. But Pi wants to know about other religions. He makes friends with a Christian priest. He also makes friends with a Muslim baker. Pi says he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian. Everyone is surprised. His family and teachers tell him to pick one religion. Pi says no. He says, "I just want to love God." After that, his family and teachers let him choose his own religion.

Religion is important to Pi. His family is Hindu, but he is interested in other religions too. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi surprises everyone by saying he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian all at once. When his family and teachers ask him to choose only one religion, Pi refuses. He explains, "I just want to love God." Some people believe that writing down dreams can help you have "lucid dreams." In a lucid dream, you know you are dreaming. You can also choose what happens in your dream. For example, you can change a bad dream into a good one. Or you can control your dream like a movie director. This means you make your dreams instead of just understanding them. But it's still good to have some dreams where your mind tells you things.

Some people believe that if you write down your dreams, you might start having lucid dreams. A lucid dream is when you know you are dreaming and you can also control what happens in it. This means you could change a scary dream into a pleasant one, or guide the story of your dream, much like a film director. So, instead of just trying to understand what your dreams mean, you would be actively creating them. However, it's still helpful to have some dreams where your subconscious mind can show you what you are thinking or feeling.

People give old clothes to charity. They think this helps. But charity shops cannot sell all clothes. Many clothes are "fast fashion." This means they are cheap and go out of style fast. They are often bad quality. So, people do not want to buy them again. A lot of clothes are thrown away. Some clothes are sent to other countries. This causes problems for money and nature.

People often donate old clothes to charity, thinking they are helping with the problem of too much clothing. However, charity shops cannot sell all the clothes they receive. A big reason for this is "fast fashion," which refers to clothes that quickly go out of style and are often made poorly. Because of their low quality, these items are hard to recycle, and people usually don't want to buy them second-hand. As a result, many clothes are thrown away. Also, charities send a lot of unsold clothes to other countries, which creates more economic and environmental issues.

Meagan McGrath, from Canada, is a very adventurous person. She enjoys taking on many challenges. She has climbed the tallest mountain on every continent and cycled across Canada. Some cities want artists to paint graffiti in special places. This helps stop them from painting on all walls. For example, in Taiwan, there are 'graffiti zones'. Artists can paint freely there. In São Paulo, Brazil, artists can even paint on subway trains.

Faith47 is an artist from Cape Town, South Africa. She paints big, colourful pictures of people and animals. You can find her art on streets, in old buildings, and on old cars. She likes that her art does not stay forever. Rain or cleaners from the city take it away. She thinks this shows how life changes, with endings and new beginnings.

Faith47 is an artist who comes from Cape Town in South Africa. She paints large, colourful pictures of people and animals. She likes to paint in many different places. You can find her artwork on pavements, in empty factories, and on old cars. She enjoys that most street art is temporary. It is often removed by the weather or by city cleaners. Gabriela used to work where bosses had a lot of power. People respected their leaders very much. Leaders made all the big decisions, and no one usually questioned them. But her new team in Sweden was different. In Sweden, workers and bosses often worked together. They found answers and made choices together. Leaders there helped people learn. They wanted people to think for themselves and ask questions.

Gabriela previously worked in a company where leaders had a lot of power. People respected authority, and everyone had their specific role. In this environment, leaders made important decisions and were not often questioned. However, her Swedish team was used to a different culture. In their workplace, employees often collaborated with their managers to find solutions and make decisions. Here, leaders acted as coaches, encouraging independent thinking and expecting to be challenged.

Gabriela saw that she and her team were different. She talked to them about her leadership. The team was happy to talk. They said they did not like being told what to do. They liked to work freely and be creative. When Gabriela told them everything to do, they felt she did not trust them. They understood that Gabriela felt bad when they changed her ideas. They told her this is how they always worked.

Gabriela noticed cultural differences between herself and her team. She decided to talk to them openly about how they felt about her leadership. The team was glad she asked for their opinions. They told her they were not used to being told exactly what to do. They preferred to have more freedom to take initiative and be creative. When Gabriela gave them very specific instructions, they felt she did not trust them to do their work well. They also realized that Gabriela took it personally when they tried to question or change her decisions. They explained that this was simply how they had always worked.

Os Gêmeos are two brothers. They are twins and look the same. They are from São Paulo. They paint big, colorful pictures of people. They paint on buildings. Their art is often very big. They use cranes, which are big machines, to help them paint. In 2007, they painted a whole castle in Scotland.

Os Gêmeos are identical twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint many things, from small tags to large, colorful pictures of people on buildings. Their artwork is often so big that they need cranes to help them reach high places. For example, in 2007, they painted an entire castle in Scotland.

People have always drawn and written on walls. A long time ago, people in Africa and Europe drew animals and people inside caves. We can see old writings on buildings in places like Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In an old Roman town called Pompeii, people found many writings in Latin. These writings were about religion, politics, love, and even magic.

People have painted and written on walls throughout history. In ancient times, people in Africa and Europe painted pictures of animals and people inside caves. Do you dream of climbing Mount Everest or walking to the South Pole? Many people do. Every year, thousands try to climb very high mountains or walk across big lands. Old explorers used maps and compasses. But today, adventurers use new tools like GPS and special phones. Some adventurers love nature. They travel to tell people about problems with the environment. Others want to help people and collect money for good causes.

Have you ever imagined climbing Mount Everest or traveling to the South Pole? You are not alone. Every year, thousands of people try to climb the world's highest mountains or walk across continents. Unlike past explorers who used maps and compasses, today's adventurers use modern technology like GPS and satellite phones. Many adventurers are nature lovers who use their trips to raise awareness about environmental issues. Others want to help people in need and raise money for charities.

DART is a test. It means "Double Asteroid Redirection Test." Scientists want to hit a small moon of an asteroid. This moon is called Didymoon. It is 150 meters wide. It goes around a bigger asteroid called Didymos, which is 800 meters wide. They hope DART will push Didymoon a little. Then, telescopes on Earth can see the change.

The first project is called DART, which stands for Double Asteroid Redirection Test. Scientists plan to test DART by hitting a moon of an asteroid named Didymos. This moon, called 'Didymoon', is 150 meters wide and orbits its larger parent asteroid, Didymos, which is 800 meters wide. The hope is that DART's impact will change Didymoon's orbit enough for telescopes on Earth to observe it.

Katniss Everdeen is a 16-year-old girl. Her father died in a mine. She must find food for her family. She hunts in the forest with her friend Gale. She is good with a bow and arrow. Her sister, Prim, is chosen for a dangerous game. Katniss says she will go instead. Another boy, Peeta, also goes from her home. Katniss and Peeta have a difficult relationship.

Katniss Everdeen is the main character, a sixteen-year-old girl. Her father died in a mining accident, so she has to find food for her family. She hunts in the woods near her home, District 12, with her friend Gale. She is very skilled with a bow and arrow. When her younger sister, Prim, is chosen as a tribute, Katniss decides to go instead. The other tribute from District 12 is a boy named Peeta, and Katniss soon has a complicated relationship with him.

If you write about your dreams, you will remember them better. Think about the people and places in your dream. This can help you understand it. After one week, you will see you wrote a lot. Then, you can link your dreams to your daily life and feelings.

When you write about your dreams, you will begin to remember more details. Also, consider the people and places in your dream, as they can help you understand its meaning. Long ago, many bridges were made of wood. Wood can burn easily. So, these bridges often caught fire. This was a big problem for old train bridges. Trains have metal wheels and tracks. These could make sparks. The sparks could start a fire, and the bridge would burn completely.

By 2010, NASA's planetary defense team had found and recorded 90% of the asteroids near Earth that are 1 kilometer wide. These are called 'near-Earth objects' or NEOs. Ed Stafford, from the UK, was the first person to walk the entire Amazon River. He started his journey at a small stream in the Andes mountains of Peru and walked to the river's mouth in Brazil. In Britain, people spend over £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is about 4% of their money. But there are two big problems. Many people use credit cards to buy clothes. In Britain, the average person spends more than £1,000 on new clothes every year. This amount is about four percent of their yearly income. However, this number hides two serious problems for society and the environment. Firstly, much of this spending is done using credit cards. British adults currently owe around £670 each to credit card companies. This debt makes up 66 percent of their average clothing budget. Secondly, people are not only spending money they don't have, but they are also buying things they don't really need. As a result, Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing annually. Most of these clothes end up in landfill sites, harming the environment.

Businesses have discovered that the "sharing economy" can be very profitable. They want to use resources that are not fully utilized, such as empty rooms or cars. Zoos have a very important job. They help animals have babies, especially animals that are in danger. These are called endangered species. A good zoo helps these animals live and have babies in a safe place. Also, when there are fewer wild animals, there is a bigger risk that their groups become too similar genetically. Breeding programs help with this: animals born in zoos can be put back into the wild to make the animal groups more diverse.

Good relationships are very important for happiness. A study showed that most happy people have strong connections with their friends and family, and they spend time with them regularly. It's also important to have at least one person you can share your personal feelings with. This is called 'self-disclosure'. One close friend for deep talks is enough, along with other friends. Carol Dweck is a psychologist. She says our brain can change and learn new things. We can get better at skills we were not good at before. People often praise only what someone is good at, like "You are good at details." But studies show it is better to praise effort. Praise trying new things and solving problems. This helps us learn new skills and get better at what we do.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist, believes our brains can change and grow. She says we can develop new skills and talents, even if we were not good at them initially. Often, we tend to praise only the final result or natural abilities, for example, saying "You have a talent for organizing." However, research suggests that by focusing on the process—praising effort, trying new things, and problem-solving—we can encourage the development of new skills and improve existing talents.

The rover checks the air often. In 2014, it found methane. Methane is a simple gas. It is also in natural gas. Methane does not last long, only a few hundred years. So, something on Mars makes new methane. NASA says Mars lets out a lot of methane. The amount of methane changes with the seasons. It is like Mars is breathing.

The rover regularly checks the air around it. In 2014, it discovered methane, which is a basic organic molecule and a key part of natural gas. Methane only stays in the air for a few hundred years. This means that something on Mars must be creating more of it. According to NASA, Mars releases thousands of tons of methane at a time. The amount of methane goes up and down with the seasons, almost as if the planet is breathing.

Carol Dweck is a psychologist. She gave hard problems to ten-year-old children. Some children liked the hard problems. They thought they could learn and get better. This is called a 'growth mindset'. They looked forward to what they could do. Other children felt bad. They thought they were not smart enough. This is called a 'fixed mindset'. They could not imagine getting better. Some even said they might cheat. Others looked for kids who did worse to feel better about themselves.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist from Stanford University, gave difficult problems to ten-year-old children. One group of children reacted well. They said they liked challenges and believed they could improve their skills. Dweck called this a 'growth mindset', meaning they focused on what they could achieve in the future. However, another group felt their intelligence was being judged, and they had failed. They had a 'fixed mindset', believing they could not get smarter. Some of these children even considered cheating, while others tried to find someone who had performed worse to feel better about themselves.

News often says the world is getting more violent. But there is also good news. After World War II until 1990, 30 big wars happened. Many people died in these wars. Many people believe that developing countries are in a very bad state. They think these countries have extreme poverty, are ruled by dictators, and have little chance for real improvement. However, this idea is often wrong. In reality, big changes are happening. Over the last 20 years, more than 700 million people have earned more money and are no longer poor. Managers often give good comments, then bad comments, then good comments again. This is like a 'feedback sandwich.' But workers might think the good comments are not real. They might think these good comments are just to make the bad news easier. This makes the good comments less useful. Instead, good comments should help workers do better. They should show what is done well.

To make feedback sound more positive, many managers give negative comments between two positive ones. This is often called a 'feedback sandwich.' However, if this method is used too often, employees may start to see the positive feedback as just a way to soften the negative parts. This makes the positive feedback less meaningful. Instead, positive feedback should be given to truly encourage and reinforce good performance, not just to cushion criticism.

I am a member of the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. We should not think about robots from movies. Instead, we should think about what is happening now. Military machines, like drones and gun robots, are already used to kill people with very little human control. The next step will be robots that can decide on their own who to kill. This would be very wrong and dangerous for all people. We need to be very careful about what we allow machines to do.

Many people learn English. More people learn English than all other languages. English is used in the most countries. But Chinese has the most native speakers. Native speakers are people who learn a language from birth. The number of native speakers does not mean many people learn that language. But if a language is used in many countries, many people learn it.

More people are learning English than all other languages put together. English is also spoken in the highest number of countries. However, Chinese has the most native speakers. There is not much connection between how many native speakers a language has and how many people learn it. But there is a clearer link between the number of people learning a language and how many countries speak it.

Your boss wants to talk about your work. You feel worried all weekend. On Monday, your boss says you did good work. But you think she will say something bad next. This is called a "feedback sandwich." It means: first, say something nice. Then, say what you really want to say (something not so good). Last, say something nice again.

Your manager tells you she needs to talk about your performance on a recent project. You worry about this all weekend, wondering what mistakes you might have made. When you meet her, she first praises your good work. You suspect this is the start of a "feedback sandwich," which is a way of giving feedback: first, say something positive, then give the real criticism, and finally, say something positive again.

'Born in the USA' is a fast rock album. The songs have strong feelings. The music is catchy, but the words tell sad stories. They talk about the hard parts of the American dream. Many songs are about normal people who work hard. They feel angry because they don't get rich or famous. For example, 'Glory Days' is about people remembering their youth. 'Downbound Train' is about a man who loses his job and his life gets bad. The singer seems to write about real people he knew. This album shows that 'The Boss' is a very special singer.

'Born in the USA' is a rock album with fast music. But its lyrics are full of emotion. The catchy rock songs tell stories about the difficult side of the American dream. Many tracks describe the problems of everyday people who work hard. They feel angry and disappointed because they do not become rich or famous. For instance, 'Glory Days' is about people in a small town who remember their younger, more hopeful times. 'Downbound Train' tells the story of a young man whose life is ruined after he loses his job. It seems the artist writes about real people he knew and the life he might have lived if he hadn't become famous. This album clearly shows the special talent of 'The Boss'.

Lewis wants to protect more of the ocean. Now, only 3% of the ocean is protected. He wants 10% to be protected. This is to fix damage from people. People catch too many fish, make the water dirty, and throw trash. Lewis saw this damage. He saw white coral reefs because the water was too hot. He saw parts of the Red Sea with no life, only plastic. Lewis thinks nature can get better if we give it space. But we must hurry. If we don't take care of our seas, we will have a big problem we cannot fix.

Lewis wants to see more parts of the ocean protected. He hopes to increase these areas from 3% to 10% globally. This is to help reverse the damage caused by human activities like overfishing, pollution, and littering. Lewis has personally seen this environmental destruction during his expeditions. He has swum over coral reefs that have turned white due to warmer water, and observed underwater areas in the Red Sea that are empty of life and filled with plastic. Pugh believes nature can recover if given the chance, but time is short. If we don't start caring for our seas, we could soon have an unsolvable problem.

Terrie Sharp writes popular books. She won an award for crime stories two times. She grew up in a difficult part of Glasgow. There was a lot of crime there. She learned to be quiet and stay safe. She also learned how to open car doors with a knife. But she only used this skill for her books. Now, she talks a lot. She is on TV shows like Police Today. She also goes to writing events in the UK.

Terrie Sharp is a best-selling author who has won the Olive Crime Writer Award twice. She grew up in a high-crime area of Glasgow. There, she learned to be quiet, avoid trouble, and even how to open car doors with a knife. Fortunately, she only used this knowledge to write her books. Nowadays, she is quite outspoken, appearing on popular TV shows like Police Today and at writing conferences throughout the UK.

Steven Pinker wrote a book called "Enlightenment Now." He says life is getting better. People live longer, are healthier, more free, and happier. But Pinker thinks some good ideas are in danger. These ideas are using reason and science. Some people try to make others angry or scared. They make people not trust each other. This can hurt important things like democracy (fair government) and countries working together.

Many people wonder if life is getting worse. But Steven Pinker, in his book "Enlightenment Now," shares good news about human progress. He says we are living longer, healthier, freer, and happier lives. Pinker believes the main problem is that important values like reason and science are under attack. When speakers or leaders appeal to people's group loyalty, belief in fate, or distrust, it can cause serious damage. This damage can affect important things like democracy and countries working together.

Old scary movies showed people who could not call for help. They could not call the police. This made the movies scary. Now, people have mobile phones. It is easy to call for help. So, scary movies need a new idea. What if there is no phone signal? Or the phone battery dies? This makes the movie scary again. When the hero needs help, their phone will not work.

In older scary movies, people in danger found it hard to call for help or the police. Today, mobile phones make this situation less believable. To keep the movies exciting, a common solution is to show no phone signal. Or, the phone battery dies right when someone needs to make an important call. So, when a hero really needs help, their phone often won't work.

In the 1950s, banana farmers had a big problem. Their best banana, called Gros Michel or Big Mike, was dying. Now, the next banana, called Cavendish, is also dying. Gros Michel bananas were easy to move. They had thick skin and tasted sweet. A company named United Fruit grew many of these bananas. They grew new plants from parts of old plants, not from seeds. They planted them very close together.

In the 1950s, banana farmers in Central America had a big problem. Their most profitable banana, the Gros Michel, also known as Big Mike, was dying. Now, the same thing is happening to the Cavendish banana, which took Big Mike's place. The Gros Michel banana was popular because it was easy to move, had a thick skin, and tasted sweet. United Fruit, a large company then, grew these bananas very effectively. They created new plants by cloning parts from existing plants instead of using seeds, and they planted them close together in fields.

Most spiders have poison. They use it to catch food, not to hurt people. Only a few kinds of spiders, about 25, can hurt humans with their poison. Spider bites can hurt, but people rarely die from them. For example, a dangerous spider in Australia, the Sydney funnel-web, has not killed anyone since 1981. This is because doctors made medicine for its bite. Be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. If they feel scared, they throw out tiny, itchy hairs. These hairs can get into your skin or eyes and cause pain.

Most spiders have venom, which they use to stun or kill their prey, not to attack humans. In fact, only about 25 known spider species produce venom that can actually harm people. While spider bites can be painful, they are very rarely deadly. For instance, Australia's well-known Sydney funnel-web spider has not caused any deaths since an anti-venom was developed in 1981. However, you should be careful with hairy spiders, like tarantulas. When these spiders feel threatened, they defend themselves by releasing a cloud of irritating hairs. These hairs can then get stuck in the skin or eyes of an attacker.

This is a common idea in scary movies from the late 1900s. A group of young people have fun. But then, everyone dies except one girl. At first, she is shy and not strong. By the end, she becomes very strong and smart. She usually wins.

This common idea was very popular in horror films from the late 20th century. It usually starts with a group of teenagers having fun. But then, everyone dies except one girl. At first, she is innocent, shy, and not very strong. By the end, she becomes the toughest and most resourceful person. She almost always wins.

We want to know how humans learned to use complex language. We need to look at how our brains are different from animal brains. It's not just about brain size. It's about what our brains can do. It's also about when and why they changed. We don't have many clues from old things our ancestors left. These things don't tell us what they said. But we can see how their mouths, throats, and tongues changed. By 100,000 years ago, humans could make many different sounds. Before that, we can only guess if early humans used simple sounds to talk.

To understand how humans developed the ability for complex language, we should examine how our brains differ from those of other animals. This involves more than just brain size; it's important to consider what our brains can do, and when and why these abilities evolved. There are very few physical clues to help us with this; for example, old tools don't tell us what kind of speech our ancestors could make. However, one thing we can observe in the remains of early humans is the development of their mouth, throat, and tongue. By about 100,000 years ago, humans had developed the skill to create complex sounds. Before this time, scientists can only guess whether early humans communicated using simpler sounds.

Girls are often told what to study. Society tells them to like arts, not math or science. Boys are often shown doing math and science. Girls do not see many women doing science jobs. TV shows and books often show men as scientists. People also think scientists are strange or lonely. These ideas are not true. But they make girls think science is not for them. If girls saw more women scientists, they would feel better about science. They would feel like they belong.

Society, not nature, often influences what subjects girls choose. Girls are often encouraged to study arts and humanities, while boys are seen as better at math and physics. Also, there are not enough positive female role models for young girls to see in science-related jobs. Cartoons and stories often show male scientists, inventors, or astronauts. Many people also wrongly believe that scientists are awkward, have poor social skills, or work alone. These are false ideas from the media. They can make girls feel that science is not for them and not an attractive career. If girls saw more positive female role models in science, they would feel more confident and connected to these subjects.

The Scallion is a newspaper. It comes out every week. It is free. You can find it in school buildings. About 10,000 students read it. Students write and make the newspaper. Students and teachers like it. They like it for fun, culture, and work practice. Printing the newspaper costs a lot of money. Some students cannot get the paper easily. They have to go to the university to get one. Also, many papers become trash on campus. This is bad for the environment.

The Scallion is a newspaper that is printed every week. It is given out for free in university buildings. Around 10,000 students read it. Students write and produce the entire newspaper. A survey shows that both university students and staff value the newspaper. They like it for entertainment, cultural learning, and work experience. However, printing the newspapers is expensive. Also, some students find it hard to get a copy because they have to go to the university in person. Another problem is that many copies are left as litter on campus, which is bad for the environment.

At Girox Foods, many people leave their jobs every year. About 12 out of 100 workers leave. This is more than other companies, where only 7 out of 100 leave. This report will find out why workers are not happy. It will also give ideas to make work better. This will help more workers stay at Girox Foods.

At Girox Foods, about 12% of our employees leave their jobs every year. This is higher than the industry average of 7%. The main goal of this report is to understand why employees are leaving. We also want to suggest ways to improve their experience at work and help more employees stay with the company.

I agree with many things the speaker said. I think it is dangerous. When we are more connected with others, we might feel more alone. This is not a big problem for older people like me. We lived without technology for a long time. We know how to be by ourselves. We know it is okay to be alone. But young people, under 20, are different. They talk a lot using technology. They never feel quiet time alone. They might not learn to like being by themselves. Also, they learn to talk using messages they can change. They do not learn how to talk face-to-face with someone right now.

I agree with much of what the speaker said. I truly believe there is a risk that the more connected we become, the more isolated we might feel. This is not such a big issue for my generation, who lived without technology for a long time. We know how to be alone, and we understand that it is fine to be by ourselves. However, young people under 20 are different. They are so busy communicating that they rarely experience solitude. This means they might not learn to enjoy their own company. Furthermore, they learn to have conversations through messages that can be edited. This happens instead of learning the skill of real, live conversation with someone in front of them.

Do not always give good comments and bad comments together. If you always do this, the good comments might seem less important. People might not listen to them. Sometimes, just give good comments by themselves. Do not always give advice for improvement right after good comments.

You should not always give positive feedback immediately followed by negative feedback. When positive and negative comments are always given together, the positive ones can lose their value and be overlooked. Make sure there are times when you give positive feedback on its own. Try to avoid always adding constructive criticism after positive comments.
